page.title: 14THE HOSPITAL IN BANKS
page.content: GREAVES HALL HOSPITAL IN BANKS COVERS THREE SECTIONS OF MENTAL ILLNESS. IT IS A HOSPITAL FOR BOTH DAY AND FOR RESIDENT PATIENTS.GREAVES HALL IS A SELF CONTAINED COMMUNITY AND FOR THE PATIENTS WHO LIVE THERE THEY TRY TO MAKE IT AS MUCH LIKE HOME AS POSSIBLE. PATIENTS HAVE PENSION BOOKS AND OPEN ACCOUNTS IN THE GREAVES HALL BANK. THERE IS A SWIMMING POOL,RECREATION ROOM AND GYMNASIUM AS WELL AS SHOPS. SOME PATIENTS ARE ENTERING THE SPECIAL OLYMPICS IN WALES.THE OLDEST PATIENTS ARE IN THEIR NINETIES AND NO CHILDREN ARE ADMITTED AS PATIENTS. THE NURSES WORK SHIFTS.THERE IS A SCHOOL FOR STUDENT NURSES. GROUPS OF PATIENTS ARE SOMETIMES TAKEN OUT FOR THE DAY TO NEARBY TOWNS. THE DEGREE OF SEVERITY OF ILLNESS VARIES AMONG PATIENTS. IT IS LIKE A LITTLE VILLAGE IN ITSELF.
